subject: Psychology
title: Defining Emotion
description: A short lesson to help you apply Defining Emotion.

hook.text: You feel angry but can't explain why. You feel happy but can't define happiness. Emotion is slippery.

buildup.text: Psychologists define emotion as a short-lived response involving feelings, bodily changes, and behavior.

discovery.text: Emotions differ from moods. Emotions are intense and brief. Moods are mild and last hours or days.

twist.text: After a century of research, psychologists still disagree on exactly what an emotion is.

climax.text: Emotion sits at the intersection of body, mind, and culture ‚Äî which is why it's so hard to pin down.

punchline.text: Everyone feels emotions. Nobody can fully define them.

quiz.question: How do emotions differ from moods?
options: Emotions are intense and brief; moods are mild and lasting
Emotions last for days; moods are fleeting
There is no difference between them
